Transmission

Class Agent

  • java.lang.Object
    • Transmission.Agent

  • public class Agent
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the agent class that contains the variables and methods of the agent.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) java.lang.String culturalTraits
      This is the cultural traits that are expressed as a string (for output purposes only)
      private repast.simphony.space.grid.Grid<java.lang.Object> grid
      A grid that reflects the space the agent is in
      (package private) double innovationRate
      This controls how often an agent's traits will change
      (package private) int nTraits
      The number of traits running in a simulation
      (package private) double replacementRate
      The replacement rate of an agent, where this variable controls how fast or likely an agent will reproduce himself/herself
      private repast.simphony.space.continuous.ContinuousSpace<java.lang.Object> space
      The continuous space in which the agent operates in
      int traitRange
      The range in which traits can vary (e.g., 0-9 would mean 0-9 possible values for any given trait)
      (package private) java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> traits
      The list that carries the traits in the simulation
      (package private) java.lang.String transmissionType
      This is the the transmission type running in the simulation

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int changeEvolve(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> lTraits, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> oTraits)
      This is similar to the evolve traits method except it takes two lists (one set of traits; lTraits) and then it gives it to another (oTraits)
      void death()
      This method simply removes the agent from the simulation.
      void doResults()
      A method to convert the list of traits to a String.
      void encounter(java.lang.String encounter)
      This is a neighbourhood search and encounter for an agent where the agent finds someone and then evolves their cultural traits based on an encounter.

      This randomly changes a specific index value in a list of traits

      This method controls the evolution of a given trait by random change.

      The neighbourhood of cells that is obtained from a given region

      An agent moves from one location to another random location.
      double neighborProbability(java.util.List<repast.simphony.query.space.grid.GridCell<Agent>> agents)
      Summed value of the prestige trait for all agents in a neighbourhood
      void populationEncounter()
      This method does the population encounter type scenario.
      int prestige(java.util.List<repast.simphony.query.space.grid.GridCell<Agent>> gridCells)
      This evolves based on prestige values such that: probability P of copy of each neighbour as (1+traits[prestigeIndex])/sum(all neighbours (traits[prestigeIndex]+1)) then select a neighbour with computed Ps and copy its value at prestigeIndex (index location of prestige value)
      void replacement()
      This method does the replacement for an agent, where the agent then dies at the end.
      void setCulturalTraits(java.lang.String culturalTraits) 
      void step()
      This is a method that controls the simulation steps for each agent.

     repast.simphony.space.grid.Grid<java.lang.Object> grid)
        The constructor for an agent. This creates agents when they are needed (i.e, at the beginning and during runtime.
        Parameters:
        space - the space in which an agent operates in.

      • evolveSpecificValue

        public void evolveSpecificValue(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> useTraits,
                       int v)
        This randomly changes a specific index value in a list of traits
        Parameters:
        useTraits - the traits list to change
        v - the index value to change

      • evolveValue

        public void evolveValue(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> useTraits)
        This method controls the evolution of a given trait by random change.
        Parameters:
        useTraits -

      • move

        public void move()
        An agent moves from one location to another random location.

      • death

        public void death()
        This method simply removes the agent from the simulation.

      • step

        public void step()
        This is a method that controls the simulation steps for each agent. As the simulation begins, this method is called automatically. The method then selects the appropriate scenario type and launches relevant methods. Users setup the type of scenario in the parameters.xml file.

      • encounter

        public void encounter(java.lang.String encounter)
        This is a neighbourhood search and encounter for an agent where the agent finds someone and then evolves their cultural traits based on an encounter.
        Parameters:
        encounter - the encounter type (regular encounter or prestige)

      • prestige

        public int prestige(java.util.List<repast.simphony.query.space.grid.GridCell<Agent>> gridCells)
        This evolves based on prestige values such that: probability P of copy of each neighbour as (1+traits[prestigeIndex])/sum(all neighbours (traits[prestigeIndex]+1)) then select a neighbour with computed Ps and copy its value at prestigeIndex (index location of prestige value)
        Parameters:
        gridCells - the neighbourhood of cells

      • neighborProbability

        public double neighborProbability(java.util.List<repast.simphony.query.space.grid.GridCell<Agent>> agents)
        Summed value of the prestige trait for all agents in a neighbourhood
        Parameters:
        agents - the agents from a neighbourhood
        Returns:
        the summed prestige value

      • getNeighbourhood

        public java.util.List<repast.simphony.query.space.grid.GridCell<Agent>> getNeighbourhood()
        The neighbourhood of cells that is obtained from a given region
        Returns:

      • populationEncounter

        public void populationEncounter()
        This method does the population encounter type scenario.

      • changeEvolve

        public int changeEvolve(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> lTraits,
               java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> oTraits)
        This is similar to the evolve traits method except it takes two lists (one set of traits; lTraits) and then it gives it to another (oTraits)
        Parameters:
        lTraits - the list where you have one set of traits to give
        oTraits - the list where you have traits being received by an agent
        Returns:
        the location of the new value changed

      • replacement

        public void replacement()
        This method does the replacement for an agent, where the agent then dies at the end. The replacement leads to the transmission of the "genes."

      • doResults

        public void doResults()
        A method to convert the list of traits to a String.
